intro: Heptapleurum oxyphyllum, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and compact growth habit. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves that are typically arranged in a whorled pattern along its stems. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings.
